{"metadata":{"objective":"","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"D3/2/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:20px;font-weight:bold;\">Make an overview</span><br /><br />You are making a JUICE overview, but aren&#39;t quite sure what goes in each step, or how your content should look.&nbsp; This overview will show you how a typical JUICE overview is structured.<br /><br />This is the first step: It introduces the problem that you need to solve, why that problem is important, and which skill you will need to solve this problem.<br /><br />&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Add an attention grabbing image or graphic here that will illustrate the purpose or context of the Overview.<br /><br />This area can also be used to present a chart or table containing data relevant to the example presented in the overview.<br /><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":0,"audioPath":"","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>This is the second step.&nbsp; Here you will begin to walk through the steps needed to solve the problem that was presented in the previous step.<br /><br />Depending on the subject and context of the Overview you may use this step further explain the concept you&#39;re working with, or to present the first step of a problem-solving strategy.&nbsp;&nbsp; This step often does not have a right panel.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"You can edit these headers to introduce a new section"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Your explanation continues here.&nbsp; This step should definitely have a right panel.<br /><br />Think of the left panel as what you would say to a student, and the right panel as what you would show to a student on a whiteboard or in a PowerPoint.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Left panel is what you SAY</p><p>Right panel is what you SHOW</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>The right panel should include an example or illustrations of what you are saying on the left, or the &quot;PowerPoint&quot; version if there is no example.<br /><br />It should not include illustrations that are simply decorative with no meaningful information.&nbsp; This introduces visual clutter and is also a problem for accessibility.<br /><br />It should not include additional exposition or dense text, unless the example is a writing sample.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Using the right-panel:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Give an example of the point being made on the left</p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span>&nbsp; Provide the &quot;PowerPoint&quot; version if there is no example.</p><p><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x</span>&nbsp; Avoid decorative illustrations that do not convey meaningful information</p><p><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x&nbsp;</span> Don&#39;t include exposition or dense text unless it is an example of a piece of writing.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Students have told us that they skim the right column and then look at the left column for more info if they think they need it.&nbsp; If you are making a point that you definitely want them to read, hide the right panel so that the step breaks the left - right line.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Each step should be short so the information it contains will be easy to read and understand.<br /><br />Don&#39;t use full paragraphs.&nbsp; Instead use just a few individual sentences to provide information in &quot;bite-sized&#39; format.<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">DID YOU KNOW?</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Bite-sized text makes the content look more understandable!<br />&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Understandable JUICE:</span></p><p>Bite-sized text</p><p>No more than three lines in a &quot;paragraph&quot;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Resist the urge to decorate the text.&nbsp; It looks very plain in CAMPER, but in the context of the site, there are many other design elements and it will look much different.&nbsp; The key to JUICE is &quot;clean, clear, and understandable.&quot;<br /><br />In particular, do not use the Architect&#39;s Daughter font for exposition.&nbsp; It&#39;s characters are not well-formed and it can be hard to read and tiring for the reader who does not readily recognize patterns.<br /><br />Only use Architect&#39;s Daughter for thoughts and words that are supposed to be coming from the student.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Clean and clear JUICE:</span><br /><br />You are thinking this . . .</p><p><span class=\"ju-arch-daughter\" style=\"font-family:architects daughter,serif;font-size:15px;\">Architect&#39;s Daughter looks fun and interesting!</span><br /><br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Careful!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Use this font only for text that is supposed to be the thoughts or words of the student.</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Your explanation or steps to solve a problem continues to this step and beyond as needed.<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Tip!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Consider making an outline of your mini-lesson before you start authoring.<br />&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Amount of content determines number of steps.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Sub-topics should be separated by headers.&nbsp; Do not use periods in the headers--exclamation points or questions marks are OK.<br /><br />A subtopic section should have at least two steps.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Use a header to introduce a subtopic"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Add steps as needed to explain and work through the next subtopic following the same conventions as above.<br /><br />Keep the information structure the same throughout the mini-lesson.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Follow the same conventions as above to present information</p><p>Use a consistent information structure</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>JUICE overviews typically end with a step or two that summarizes the information presented in the overview.<br /><br />It may include a <strong>Remember!</strong> summary table with bullet points of the main ideas covered in the lesson.</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember! Making an overview</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>The <strong>first step</strong> introduces the context of the lesson, the problem that&#39;s being solved, and the skill needed to solve it.</li><li>The <strong>next steps</strong> further explain the idea being presented and walk students through the steps needed to solve the problem .</li><li>Use <strong>headers</strong> to divide the Overview&#39;s sub-topics.</li><li>Keep<strong> steps </strong>brief.<ul><li>Avoid writing in paragraphs.</li><li>Use the <strong>right panel</strong> to add short examples to support information in the left panel, or provide the &quot;PowerPoint&quot; version.</li></ul></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
